answers.answer: Hi,there is no supplement, unfortunately and limiting carbs (particularly sweets) is really the way to go.Exercise can also be beneficial to helping to control sugars.

question: Hi, I have a strong family history of diabetes.  My 10 y/o son's doctor called and reported that his A1C is 5.3 and fasting gluose is 101.  I know that ideally, I should limit his sugar intake.  But being autistic makes him very resistant to any fruits and veggies.  Thus, I wonder whether there is any supplement that may help him flush out the glucose from his body?
title: diabetes prevention for autistic child
